column3: My mind races, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. If an illusory space such as Lyhe Mheg can exist, who is to say there aren't more? <snort>
Lest you wonder, my creator named me for their esteemed teacher, who was said to be a hermetic of unrivaled skill. I should like to meet them, but apparently they are no longer in Il Mheg.
Never have I seen such a delightful place! I'm giddy with excitement in spite of myself! <snort>
Those regions that remain sealed are rife─and ripe─with nightmares. <slurp> Tantalizing though they smell, I know I will regret devouring them...
Tyr Beq is in deep thought. This is highly uncharacteristic of a pixie, and I can't help but worry...
To not only lose a dear friend, but to know that perhaps their aether is responsible for all this... It must be very difficult for Tyr Beq.
An Lad becomes ever more unstable, and little wonder. The aether that forms them is too potent for a newborn pixie to bear.
If they continue to question their own existence, the nightmare in their heart will grow and grow until it consumes them entirely.
Pixies are simple beings. When faced with hardship, rather than fight it, it is said that they will simply abandon living altogether. I gravely fear that An Lad is on that course.
By my conjecture, the soul from which An Lad was born was no different from that of ordinary pixies.
The aether that quickened them, however, was far from ordinary─the aether of the fallen Titania. Based on their dreams of the castle, we may be certain of this.
Not so certain, however, is whether this union between aether and soul happened by chance or by design. The academic in me can't help but wonder, but I doubt that question shall ever be answered.
How did you like stepping into the dreaming world, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? I for one found it highly enjoyable─and it was in no small part due to the fine company!
Dreams may be considered a reflection of the soul. And for good or ill, pixies are the simplest souls of all.
If a part of Titania indeed lives on in An Lad, I choose to believe that they have now found the peace they deserve.
